text:
2/25/2019 https://sites.google.com/a/locusenergy.com/wiki/cls-support/c-i-training/acquisuite-basics---external?tmpl=%2Fsystem%2Fapp%2Ftempl…
Support > C &I Training >
AcquiSuite Basics - External
AcquiSuite Basics - External
Intended for internal support reference.
AcquiSuite EMB A8810
WHAT IS IT:
The AcquiSuite is the datalogger that we use on most of our commercial sites. It is able
to detect and collect data from a variety of external devices. This document will outline
common checks we can perform externally (without logging into the AcquiSuite with a
laptop) in order to troubleshoot more efficiently.
SETTINGS CHECK:
The AcquiSuite often uses one of our cellular modems (the Digi or Multitech) to
connect but can also use a local area network. For local area network connections,
we can set the AcquiSuite to DHCP mode but if there are specific network
requirements, they will need to obtain those from the IT department for that
network.
Common Network Settings for AcquiSuite using our cell modem:
DHCP+UPnP = disabled
IP Address = 192.168.2.50
Netmask = 255.255.255.0

AI caption: **Type of image:** Photo
**Main components:** EMB AcquiSuite A8810 data acquisition unit, showing front panel connectors and display.
**Technical details:**
*   EMB AcquiSuite A8810
*   24VDC @ 300mA
*   USB Port
*   Menu
*   Alarm
*   Alarms
*   RS485
*   Shield
*   RS485 TX
*   RS485 RX
*   Ethernet
*   Ethernet Port
*   www.embusa.com

2/25/2019 https://sites.google.com/a/locusenergy.com/wiki/cls-support/c-i-training/acquisuite-basics---external?tmpl=%2Fsystem%2Fapp%2Ftempl…
Gateway = 192.168.2.1
DNS Server #1 = 8.8.4.4
DNS Server #2 = 8.8.8.8
Note: These settings are common but there are sites (often retrofits) that use
different network configurations. If there are differing settings, do not change
them unless you have confirmed that they are incorrect. If in question, check
the site drawings and/or check with the AEs.
MENU LAYOUT:
MENU NAVIGATION:
There are two external buttons on the AcquiSuite, Menu and Select, that are
located at the top right corner of the unit.
The Menu button is used to scroll through the menu options and Select is used to
advance into the currently displayed menu option.
After selecting DHCP+UPnP on/off, Menu will disable DHCP and Select will enable
DHCP mode.
When changing IP addresses in the TCP/IP Config menu, the Select button will
advance the cursor a single position and the Menu button will scroll through the
number/character options for the current cursor position.

AI caption: **Type of image:** Diagram

**Main components:** Menu structure showing the main menu branching into TCP/IP configuration, Modbus status, data upload, and reboot options. Each of these branches further into specific settings and actions.

**Technical details:**
*   Main Menu
*   TCP/IP Config: DHCP+UPnP on/off, IP Address, Netmask, Gateway, DNS Server #1, DNS Server #2, R-Access on/off, (Previous Menu)
*   Modbus Status: "X" devices okay, "Y" fail, "Z" new
*   Data Upload: Show Serial Number, Upload Data Now, (Previous Menu)
*   Reboot: (Pressing select will reboot the AS)

2/25/2019 https://sites.google.com/a/locusenergy.com/wiki/cls-support/c-i-training/acquisuite-basics---external?tmpl=%2Fsystem%2Fapp%2Ftempl…
In order to navigate back to the TCP/IP Config menu, press Select until the
cursor has moved to the end of the IP address.
